adjectives.description: underly (comparative more underly, superlative most underly)

adverbs.description: underly (comparative more underly, superlative most underly)

examples: The Seed-Branch […] is presently divided into two main Branches, and those two into other less; whereof some underly, others aloft, run along the Coat.

entries.meaning: (chiefly colloquial) In an inferior or inadequate manner; insufficiently (chiefly in opposition to overly).
examples: In this case, we are not in a position—at least from the perspective of the rules themselves and the values that lie behind them—to say that they are overly or underly inclusive.

verbs.description: underly (third-person singular simple present underlies, present participle underlying, simple past underlay, past participle underlain)

examples: I asked him what principles he felt should underly the care provided during such a voyage.
